medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset of crampy right lower quadrant abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain started at approximately 7 PM the previous night and developed over the course of several hours, with worsening right lower quadrant abdominal pain that radiates to the back. The patient also reports nausea, non-bloody non-bilious emesis, and episodes of watery diarrhea. Denies fever, bright red blood per rectum, chest pain, shortness of breath, recent travel, and sick contact.
